snippet: Russia’s prosecution of low-level participants at protests seems to be a message to other ordinary Russians about taking part.
abstract: Russia's prosecution of low-level participants at anti-government protests seems to be a warning to other ordinary Russians about taking part; situation is illustrated by plight of Yaroslav Belousov, political science student who was caught up in mayhem and arrested when 2012 rally against Vladimir V Putin unexpectedly turned violent; he has been in jail ever since.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ANDREW ROTH

lead_paragraph: Russia’s prosecution of low-level participants at protests seems to be a message to other ordinary Russians about taking part.

headline.seo: Trial Sends Warning to Rank-and-File Putin Foes
headline.main: Moscow Trial Sends Warning to Rank-and-File Putin Foes
headline.print_headline: Moscow Trial Sends Warning To Rank-and-File Putin Foes
